title: Why space debris keeps falling out of the sky—and will continue to do so
summary: "All spacefaring nations should follow established best practices."

title: NASA to Host Briefings, Interviews for Agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 Mission
summary: A pair of news conferences on Thursday, Aug. 4, at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston will highlight the agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission to the International Space Station.

title: Hyundai partners with research institutes to develop vehicle for lunar surface exploration
summary: The Korean carmaker and its sister company Kia Motors formed a consortium July 27 with six state-funded research institutes here to explore the concept of lunar exploration mobility and core technologies required.

title: NASA revises requirements for ISS private astronaut missions
summary: NASA is changing rules for future private astronaut missions to the International Space Station, including requiring such missions to be led by a former NASA astronaut.

title: Rocket Lab’s Electron to launch NROL-199 mission
summary: Rocket Lab is scheduled to launch the 29th Electron mission on August 2 at 05:00 UTC. NROL-199 will launch from Launch Complex-1B (LC-1B) at Rocket Lab’s launch facility on the Māhia Peninsula in New Zealand.
